channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A deadline approaches as ACA subsidies hang in the balance
item.description: Congress is weighing an extension of the Affordable Care Act subsidies while millions of Americans are unsure what their insurance will cost next year.
item.content:encoded: Congress is weighing an extension of the Affordable Care Act subsidies while millions of Americans are unsure what their insurance will cost next year.
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: As Congress fights over ACA subsidies, another path emerges
item.description: Craig Garthwaite, Director of the Program on Healthcare at Northwestern University and co-author of a new paper from the Aspen Economic Strategy Group, talks about reforms that could make healthcare cheaper and more efficient.
item.content:encoded: Craig Garthwaite, Director of the Program on Healthcare at Northwestern University and co-author of a new paper from the Aspen Economic Strategy Group, talks about reforms that could make healthcare cheaper and more efficient.
item.dc:creator: Avery Keatley

item.title: Can Inter Miami's title win push MLS into the mainstream?
item.description: Lionel Messi leads Inter Miami to its first MLS Cup, sparking new questions about the league's future. Paul Tenorio of The Athletic was at the final and shared his views.
item.content:encoded: Lionel Messi leads Inter Miami to its first MLS Cup, sparking new questions about the league's future. Paul Tenorio of The Athletic was at the final and shared his views.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Pierre

item.title: Do Oscar wins make directors more daring?
item.description: What happens when a director tries to follow up an Oscar win, with NPR's Marc Rivers and film critic Kyle Wilson.
item.content:encoded: What happens when a director tries to follow up an Oscar win, with NPR's Marc Rivers and film critic Kyle Wilson.
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: A surge of history on TV reflects race to define collective memory
item.description: A retelling of James Garfield's assassination and other recent TV programs about history show an interest in saying 'who we were, who we are and who we're going to be,' explains presidential historian Alexis Coe, senior fellow at New America.
item.content:encoded: A retelling of James Garfield's assassination and other recent TV programs about history show an interest in saying 'who we were, who we are and who we're going to be,' explains presidential historian Alexis Coe, senior fellow at New America.
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: A royal romance novel with the British throne at stake
item.description: Rebecca Armitage, author of the novel 'The Heir Apparent', imagines a woman forced to choose between love and the British crown.
item.content:encoded: Rebecca Armitage, author of the novel 'The Heir Apparent', imagines a woman forced to choose between love and the British crown.
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: A new book returns to America's final public hanging
item.description: A new book examines the racist background of the last public hanging in the U.S. when tens of thousands of people came to watch in a small Kentucky town.
item.content:encoded: A new book examines the racist background of the last public hanging in the U.S. when tens of thousands of people came to watch in a small Kentucky town.
item.dc:creator: Derek Operle

item.title: The Hepatitis B Foundation warns new guidance could undo decades of progress
item.description: Dr. Chari Cohen, president of the Hepatitis B Foundation, says there is no scientific basis for scaling back newborn hepatitis B shots.
item.content:encoded: Dr. Chari Cohen, president of the Hepatitis B Foundation, says there is no scientific basis for scaling back newborn hepatitis B shots.
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Damen

item.title: A year on, protesters in Tbilisi, Georgia refuse to accept pivot to Russia
item.description: Protesters in Tbilisi, Georgia mark a year of unrest, accusing the government of ditching Europe for closer ties with Russia.
item.content:encoded: Protesters in Tbilisi, Georgia mark a year of unrest, accusing the government of ditching Europe for closer ties with Russia.
item.dc:creator: Robin Forestier-Walker

item.title: Yves Jarvis drops deluxe edition of 'All Cylinders'
item.description: Canadian musician Yves Jarvis has released a deluxe edition of his Polaris Prize–winning album 'All Cylinders'.
item.content:encoded: Canadian musician Yves Jarvis has released a deluxe edition of his Polaris Prize–winning album 'All Cylinders'.
item.dc:creator: Kira Wakeam
